author: Gabriel T. Rubin
title: U.S. Regulator Floats New Way of Measuring Global Swaps Market
text:
A U.S. regulator wants to change the way it measures the size of the global swaps market, following years of criticism that the current metric is meaningless and not illuminating.
Commodity Futures Trading Commission Chairman J. Christopher Giancarlo announced in a speech in New York on Thursday that the agency has come up with an alternative way of measuring interest-rate swaps. The new approach will allow for better comparisons of the swaps market to, for example, the U.S. Treasury or corporate-bond markets.
